Pre-Game Insights: India will be coming to this contest on the back of some steaming form in the shortest format of the game as they tamed the likes of a high-flying Australia and full-fledged South Africa back home while also getting the better of the hosts in a warm-up contest.

India will have a major leak to plug when it comes to their death bowling. With Jasprit Bumrah out of the equation, a lot will rely on the shoulders of an experienced Bhuvneshwar Kumar and a young Arshdeep Singh while only time shall reveal who should be the third pacer that Team India may opt for.

Pakistan has been in the midst of a tempestuous journey of late where they drubbed New Zealand and Bangladesh in a tri-series but were also tamed by England back home and in a warm-up contest ahead of the biennial extravaganza.
Miscellaneous Highlights: There is a forecast of a heavy downpour at MCG tomorrow that may significantly impact the contest and dampen the spirits of the fans and the players alike.
The return of Virat Kohli to form since the Asia Cup will act as a major uplift for the Men in Blue as he holds an impressive record against Pakistan in the shortest format of the game.
Others: India has a strong batting lineup featuring the hallowed likes of KL Rahul, Rohit Sharma, and Virat Kohli, while a rock-solid middle-order comprising SKY, Hardik Pandya, and DK will provide them the much-needed bookend.

Pakistan has a strong opening pair in Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan but their major concern will be a wobbling middle-order. They also have a fine bowling line-up featuring some of the worldâ€™s finest quicks that compensate handsomely and provide the major threat that Pakistan challenges the world with.
